alert.note: Alert for Logan; McDowell; Mingo; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 09 at 11:37PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Locally Dense River Valley Fog Overnight... ...Patchy Frost Possible in Normally Colder Spots Overnight... Mainly clear sky, light wind, and lingering low level moisture was allowing locally dense valley fog to develop, particularly along rivers and larger creeks. Fog, with visibility below a half mile at times, will require lower speeds, and greater distances between vehicles. Do not assume the road ahead is unobstructed. Use low beam headlights, and allow more time to reach your destination safely. In addition, temperatures will fall into the mid to upper 30s overnight. While there will be just enough wind to prevent a widespread frost overnight, frost can form in deeper, better sheltered valleys before dawn Tuesday. Sensitive outdoor plants may be damaged or killed if left unprotected. Take action to protect sensitive plants by covering them or bringing them indoors.
